title: Apple might not offer an upgraded chip on all iPhone models this year
content:
Apple typically releases its flagship iPhone lineup every Fall. For the past few years, the company has been including an upgraded chip across all variants of the lineup. So, for example, whether you buy the iPhone 13 Mini or iPhone 13 Pro Max, you’re still getting the same A15 Bionic chip. However, and for the

The post Apple might not offer an upgraded chip on all iPhone models this year appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Apple could limit the upcoming A16 chip to iPhone 14 Pro models and include the A15 Bionic chip in the rest of this year's lineup.
